job description:
Senior level Control Systems Software Engineer with hands-on experience integrating and debugging complex electromechanical systems. The Senior Systems Engineer will be a member of a highly skilled development team that focuses on meeting internal and external customer goals.
  • Develop software for tool platforms following LSG software engineering processes and practices
  • Analyze and quickly resolve issues reported by internal and external customers
  • Identify potential product improvements and recommend design modifications
  • Breakdown system requirements into software development activities and estimated effort
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable and robust code
  • Interact with external groups for instance manufacturing engineering and applications groups
  • Gain in-depth knowledge and understanding of inspection and metrology from systems perspective
  • Clearly present data, analysis and conclusions to peers and management
  • Write requirements, functional specifications, design verification & integration test plans
  • Demonstrate effective interpersonal and communication skills within a diverse team
  • Provide clear and timely status updates as needed
Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities:
  • Technical leadership [10%]
  • Software requirement analysis and functional specifications [10%]
  • Software Project Management [5%]
  • Software/Systems Design [10]
  • Software Development (coding and unit testing) [50%]
  • System Integration Testing (verification) [10%]
  • Documentation (release notes) [5%]
  • BS/MS Electrical Engineering or BS/MS Computer Engineering
  • Ten (10) or more years of current development experience in the following areas:
    • C, C++, Python
    • VxWorks, RTEMS, Linux
    • User Interface development using WxWidgets or similar environment
    • Threading (POSIX), TCP/IP, I/O Driver Development
    • GNU software development tool such as gcc, gmake, and gdb
    • User level Database/SQL skills. The ability to develop queries for data mining and problem investigation.
    • Ability to develop Linux scripts in languages such as bash and python
  • Experience working in process-oriented and/or agile software development environments
  • Experience with ClearCase (user & administrative-level) and other source-control/configuration management
  • Experience with motion control systems such as servos, stepper motors and piezo-electric devices.
  • Demonstrated experience leading projects and keeping to schedule
  • Customer-oriented, understands concerns from customer perspective
  • Effective listener and self-directed learner.
  • Goal-oriented, quality-focused, inspires others.
  • Strives to find simpler more efficient ways to accomplish tasks.
  • Values commitments. Holds themselves and others accountable.
  • Able to perform trade-off analysis between software/hardware sub-systems
  • SEMI conductor capital equipment expertise (desired)
  • Ability to travel occasionally to customer sites, including international
